climbs.name: Two Czech Bros get out Torqued

content.description: Start on the undercling start of "Two Czechoslovakian Brothers"(to the right of torque). Then go left from the jug to the dyno holds of "Torque" and dyno to the top.Beta Video: instagram.com/tv/CWOGYJ6DsE…(*Top is very SHARP*)
content.location: Walk down 100 steps. Bang a left walk 5mins. And its on you left next to paved bike trail.The undercling to the right of Torque on the torque boulder.

content.description: One of the best moderate boulders in the park, with great holds and fun movement on an obvious feature. Sit start with your hands matched on the perfect edges at the bottom of the overhanging corner, and open with a powerful blind throw left to the sloping edge. Follow obvious holds up the arete and into the mail slot, and quest up over the lip on good holds until you hit a two-handed finishing jug about two feet above the lip. I dropped down from here as the problems in this area don't top out, but you probably could top out and make things difficult for yourself if you want to prove a point.As of September 2020 there was zero chalk on anything above the mail slot, but the holds are all there, you just need to do a little looking. Get on this thing, it's amazing!
content.location: Overhanging left-facing corner on the Torque boulder. Start on the low edges at the bottom of the corner (same starting holds as Torque and its variations, see photo) and climb up and left.

content.description: Sit start matched in the low crimp rail. Use  a Gaston and some fancy hips and make the move to a geometric hold. Finish on the upper section of breaking my heart, avoiding the arete cave feature.
content.location: Down and left from "Breaking My Heart", to the right of “Seepage”

content.description: Start on far right corner and traverse across the dihedral to the arete, staying low. Head around the corner and make a reachy move to a small left crimp. Move up the crimpy face. Topping out is possible but not that fun. Basically Gem of a Stem plus the left side of the Mixed Up arête.

Start on "Gem of a Stem," but stay high then turn the corner to make a dynamic move with the left hand to a good jug and continue to traverse high, finishing on a high jug (the meat hook as it's sometimes known).

instagram.com/p/CQiyyUCjgeh/
content.location: Right side of the torque area, starting on "Gem of a Stem".

content.description: Start on the far right near the remains of wheatpased sign a LARPer put up to warn of the overwhelming strength of his spells (this is actually what the sign said before it faded...). Traverse left along the dihedral until you reach the left arête. Climb up until you're done, a bushwhacking top out is possible but not that fun.

A classic 3 move power boulder, if only it wasn't an eliminate!  Start as per torque, make a long move to the mail slot directly from the start, skipping all other intermediates. Match the mail slot reset feet and dyno to the torque finish. Those under 5' 10" need not apply.

Start matched on a jug to the right of the prominent crack in the middle of the face. Move left and climb the crack/flake. A bushy top out is possible, watch for poison ivy.

Beta Vid

A bouldering area directly across the creek from the (old) police station at the corner of Lincoln Drive and Gypsy Lane.  

  Torque is on the boulder with some blue spray paint on it that says "wolfto...". from the trail, it looks like a triangle on it's point. orangish color.  

  Sit start matching on the crimp. get matched in the mail slot, dyno to the lip.  

  The left variation has the same start, but breaks left into pocket like features at the first move, the right variation has the same start as torque, but breaks right at the end. A crimp comes into play, and you dyno to the lip a few feet to the right of the torque finish. Both problems are harder than torque.  

  About eight feet to the left of the torque sit starts, on the flat side of the wall, there are a few V4's.  

  Up on the hillside just down the path, further from torque, closer to forbidden drive, there's a fun ever-evolving arete that also goes in the V4 range.
